Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and fabulous accommodation”
Reviews.Author: paulukabe
Reviews.Content: The view from Guidecca is wonderful - views over the water to St Mark's Square. The Palladio has a courtesy launch to the Bauer Palazzo and two minutes from the Palladio you will find the the Zitelle vaporetti stop. The atmosphere on Guidecca is very calm compared the main island. We had a lovely garden suite which very comfortable and nicely decorated. The view of the garden was an unexpected bonus - masses of spring flowers! We had lunch in the hotel once - which good value with sensibly priced wines. Breakfast was OK. The service in the hotel was exceptional - Alessandra needs to be singled out for charm and efficiency - but everyone seemed to enjoy their job and do it well. Little touches such as the galss of prosecco on arrivel, the vases of fresh flowers and orchids in the suite and the bottle of wine on ice when we return to our rooms all contributed to this excellent hotel experience. I would recommend the Bauer Palladio most strongly (and I seldom do this).

Reviews.Title: “Share one of Venice's best-kept secrets”
Reviews.Author: Tim P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our fourth stay at this hotel. We were greeted as old friends and upgraded to a lagoon view room, which had fresh flowers and a bottle of Prosecco waiting for us. On each visit we have had at least one of our children along. The staff all looked after us very well, the rooms were great and the food in the restaurant was good enough to tempt us back evening after evening. Having stayed in many hotels around the world, this has become a real favourite. It's location on the Guidecca should not put anyone off; it's easy and fun to travel the 5 minutes journey across the lagoon to near St Mark's Square, which also happens to be the view from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valentine1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of September for 4 night break in Venice. We travelled by Water Bus from the airport and just prcked up the free shuttle from the Palazzo. The service we received from the minute we entered the reception was amazing, they took us up to our room following a short tour of the hotel and its facilities. We were given a free upgrade to an attic room which had a sitting area, TV area, dressing room and a huge bed on a mezzanine floor. Candles were lit in our room at the end of each day and fresh orchids left in the bathroom. This really was special. We would stay here again if we visit Venice. We don't eat lunch or dinner in hotels and like to experience restaurants in other places however we did have did have breakfast and I have to agree with some other comments that this was a bit disasterous. For a 5 star hotel this was very disappointing. Not enough staff, not enough cups, plates or bowls - all pretty basic as far as breakfast is concerned. My husband I ended up sharing a coffee cup! They really need to get this bit sorted. The rest though as I said was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: J0ps
Reviews.Content: Initially the hotel does not seem ideally placed- on the opposite side of the lagoon from the tourist haven which is St Marks, but rather wonderfully; (1) the hotel provides a free water shuttle service (takes about 5 minutes) straight to St Marks every 20-30 minutes until midnight (2) there is a water bus service about 20 meters from the front door to take to you other hotspots such as Murano. It was lovely to be in such a quite spot with such easy access to all the action. On the staff at the hotel- from the second you arrived until the moment you left the staff could not do enough for you- everyone was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a suite with a garden view and it was lovely. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was on the luxurious side and the room was very clean. Every time we popped out the room was obviously spruced up and new towels left. A nice touch was the little notes left on the bed by the turning down service. On the Spa- as it is a smaller hotel I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality and size of the spa. A trip (or two) to the spa is a must if staying at this hotel. We ate out every day so cannot comment too much on the food, however the one lunch we had at the hotel was very nice. One tip for smokers- you cannot buy cigarettes at night. At the hotel or in St Marks. Not all shops sell them and to use the vending machines you need an Italian health care card proving your age. Give up or stock up.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Bob0912
Reviews.Content: Situated a 5 minute water taxi ride from the centre of Venice; the hotel runs it's own free water taxi service between it and it's sister hotel very near St Marks Square which is brilliant. The hotel is sitauted on the island of Guidecca which is quiet; a nice oasis of calm after the hoards of 'Venice propper' Most of the rooms of the hotel are in an annexe which is a modern building (not in the nice old bit). Our room was ok; clean, but a little sparsely furnished. Breakfast and dinner was a disaster; totally disorganised; at breakfast they seemed to always run out of something (coffee, coffee cups, etc) and the choice was very limited. We only ate dinner at the hotel once and the service was abysmal (the food was quite good, though) Overall, the hotel was ok; not sure we would stay there again, though.

Reviews.Title: “This place (and the staff) are amazing”
Reviews.Author: LBelltraveler
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night while preparing to embark on a cruise the following day, but I fell in love with this hotel and will be back. It is a beautiful little hotel, a converted convent, with an absolutely amazing garden. This place was beautiful, the entire hotel was well appointed, well staffed and well taken care of. Pros: Staff: the staff here are so helpful and so amazing! Rooms: the rooms here are huge compared to many of the rooms in Venice. (And the rooms were very clean) Cons: the only con I could think of, and it may not be a con for every one, was the location. It is located on a separate island from the main part of Venice. They have a shuttle boat that runs every fifteen minutes to half an hour, but still if you intend to spend most of your time on the grand canal and/or St. Marks square this is a bit distant from that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Brenda M
Reviews.Content: We had a great spacious room over looking the canal. The bed was soft and a nice large bath room. The staff was friendly and they provided a water taxi over to the sister hotel on the canal. It was great. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: CGALondon_England
Reviews.Content: We chose Palladio online and have just spent four very happy days there. The location on Giudicca was superb - a five minute private boat ride from St Mark's square. Great to be just a little removed from the tourist hordes. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was spacious and very comfortable. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a very comprehensive buffet. We only had one lunch in the restaurant which was fine but there is such a wide choice of places to eat in Venice I would go outside the hotel. We booked through otel.com and got a great rate. All in all a great experience - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Living on an island......”
Reviews.Author: intricate web
Reviews.Content: First a problem. Do I rate this hotel as the five star offering advanced from Reader Offers? if so it wouldn't really pass muster on the equivalent UK ranking. However do I rate it as a Â£250 a night (incl breakfast) in horribly expensive Venice? if so it certainly deserves the 80% rating above Firstly the good bits: -impressive looking place wrapped around an ancient church, plenty of atmosphere. --lovely location on Guidecca near the Cipriani, although not much to do on the island -big rooms although we just got a view of the cloisters -a big well laid out garden, ideal for escaping the madness of Venice, especially on a sunny day. -the welcome of all welcomes from the lovely Alexandria who made you feel like it was ever so special -a classy shuttle to the mainland running every 30 minutes and free -nice approachable staff -a comfortable bed and a fine shower the bad bits: -understaffed restaurant where one night was chaotic but no doubt down to an unpredictable demand from the ROL lot coming in. -less forgiveable was the undercooked breakfast eggs and bacon(Edwina Curry don't eat here) and the frequent shortages We therefore didn't dine in but probably missed out as the chaos seems to have been a one off. However we regretted taking the advice of fellow trip advisor contributors and going to the I Figli delle Stelle down the road. Very expensive and poor food. Overall if they could get the restaurant up to the same standard as the reception, this could be a delight, even if it doesn't measure up to the glamour of real Venetian 5 star establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling like at home.....waiting for the pool”
Reviews.Author: drzimmel
Reviews.Content: This is our second time in Venice and this is our second time at this Hotel. Changed a lot of faces compared to last time but all the ladies were all very nice. We were introduced to them by our "friend" and Manager, Simone so they could recognize us during our experience. Room were on the second floor facing the lagoon (think it was 210 or 212). spacious, a bottle of prosecco waiting for us with a personal welcome letter. It was also very nice to be recognized at the restaurant after such long time. Breakfast was a little bit cahotic but the hotel was sold out. The next day we went there very early in the morning and it was not an issue at all and there were also some improvement in terms of quality.and variety. I spoiled my wife with some SPA treatments and they were all very kind to her and the treatments were excellent. Seems like they will build a pool this coming winter....at that point I think it will become the best Hotel in Venice! These guys there really know how to please a guest! As usual, little details makes the difference (good night note, a little chocolate during the turndown, being called with your name). Other little thing is that now their shuttle runs from 10 am to midnight so it is the best way to get to the other side... on a complimentary basis (very convenient!) We will defenetly come back next year (If God wants).

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: scoi00
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find such a beautiful hotel in Venice and I have seen quite some. Location is great with a boat that brings you to piazza san marco every half an hour . the trip just takes a couple of minutes. The garden and the atmosphere is amazing. Rooms large and well designed. REally a beauty. Service is very kind, a rarity in Venice. But the hotel seems mostly understaffed as they seem to have severe service problems both at dinner and at breakfast. Breakfast... I could not believe what I saw in a 5* hotel: prosciutto cotto ( cooked ham) of the worse quality. This kind of reconstructed ham that only second class pizzerias put on top of a pizza. The salami was so bad that my son that always its it at breakfast in hotels in italy refused to eat it. The bread was missing anything fresh and was all dry and chewy and even our mexican guest asked if they did not have better (fresh ?) bread (we fortunately got it without any problems at Al Covo restaurant in Venice for lunch). Marmalades ? there where only 3 to choose from, forget the popular strawberry as they did not have it. The selection of cheese was minimalistic. And so it goes on. I wonder if this Food and Beverage manager ever went to any other 4* or 5* hotels in Italy to present such a lousy quality and choice. It sad to see how the great italian food tradition is killed in such a way and this is in such a wonderful place. I will return to this great hotel, but I will definitely skip breakfast and perhaps any eating in this propriety until they prove food and it's quality is as important for them as it is for some of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with 2 tiers of guests”
Reviews.Author: PandCDoncaster
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by Readers Offers following a 6 star cruise with Seabourn. What a culture shock! We came from an environment where anything you wanted was provided to a hotel where it appeared that they would love it if they didn't have to have guests. First the good stuff. The hotel itself is beautiful. Across the lagoon from St Marks it provided a real oasis of calm. It has a wonderful perfumed garden where you can sit and read. The hotel building itself is also calm and peaceful with a huge central room where candles and a fire are lit at night. Our room was across the garden away from the main building (it was really quiet) and was quite contemporary with wooden floors and loads of windows and a large bathroom with a separate shower. Next the bad stuff bearing in mind the star rating of this hotel. When our group arrived we sat down on rows of chairs as if we were in a meeting. We had arrived in Venice 3 hours earlier and been taken on a tour to fill in some time but were not offered a drink of any description. Having been provided with the hotel shuttle launch timetable we were more or less told to go away until 2.30 when our rooms would be ready. Some fellow travelers tried to get lunch but gave up having waited 45 mins for a waiter to appear to be told that he would do his best to serve them. There were no other guests around.! On the hotel web site it says that water and prosecco are provided for guests to help themselves. When 2 members of our group took advantage of this they were told it didn't apply to groups. Are we not a guest if we arrive with more than a certain number of other people? The hotel could not provide maps and suggested we bought them at the shop next door. Breakfast was due to start at 7.00 am but the waiters didn't begin to set the tables outside until 8.00 am on the mornings we were there and in fact discouraged guests from eating outside by closing the doors into the courtyard! 'Normal' guests had a noon check out but our group, some of which were not leaving until early evening, had to check out at 10 with no option to stay in the room. Considering that this is supposed to be one of the best hotels in Venice this is not the way that I would expect them to treat their guests. For one of the best restaurants in Venice turn left out of the hotel and eat at I Figli delle Stelle just down from the hotel but make sure to book. Fabulous food at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with slight problems”
Reviews.Author: Gareth1971
Reviews.Content: Hotel fantastic ! Room amazing, junior suite. Only problem is service in the bar / restaurant, for such a wonderful hotel I ordered a glass of wine and a hot chocolate for my wife. We sat in the relaxing garden for 15/20 minutes to no avail, after a gentle reminder our drinks arrived. I expect to wait for a reasonable time if they were busy. However, there were 3 staff and two other guests. Wake up and look after your guests and they will look after you!

Reviews.Title: “Superb spa”
Reviews.Author: BigBlue1894
Reviews.Content: We didn't actually stay here but came across for the day for some spa treatments and some garden relaxation. We were actually staying at the sister hotel, the Il Palazzo near San Marco.Â  The shuttle boat runs every 20 minutes between the two and so the trip was quite convenient.Â  The spa was superb. We had the couples hammam massage which took forever and was wonderful. We both then had pedicures and I have to say that it was the best pedicure I've ever had. My feet have simply never felt as good - ever! After the treatments we went onto the terrace for some late lunch - a lovely chicken salad at a very reasonable E12 - delivered by a superb waiter called Omar.Â  The Palladio is set in an old convent (apparently Venice used to be full of them because families used to give their superfluous girls to the Church when they had run out of money for dowries.) with beautiful gardens extending a long way to the rear of the hotel. It's really crying out for a pool but I can also understand why they'd want to preserve what was there in the first place. There's a terrace with tables and some very old fashioned sun loungers in the first garden. I don't think I'd feel comfortable at sitting on them in my swimming shorts though. It just didn't seem that sort of place. I could see me staying there if I visited Venice again providing the night bus went nearby as the shuttle stopped around 12. It was a real oasis of calm amongst the thronging bustle of the main part.Â  The only moan is that the Internet didn't work. The girl on the front desk said that she was going to inform the IT department right away but I note from other reviews that this problem seems have been going on for some time. Not a massive problem and probably a decided advantage if you are on a get away from it all break but most of us like to have that facility these days if only to follow Manchester City's continual progress to the heights of football excellence. Would I recommend the spa? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “A dream visit”
Reviews.Author: Pete R
Reviews.Content: From the first emails with details on how to get from the Airport (easy) to the professional greeting at the entrance, and through our entire stay, we consider this one of the best hotels of its type in the world. We can't say enough about the warmth of the staff, the amenities offered, suggestions for the less â€œtouristyâ€� places to go, and the special nature of the building itself. Our room had a window with a gorgeous view of the town across the water and we were greeted with complimentary chilled sparkling wine. The buffet breakfasts were great with a full choice of food. Everything worked, the place was clean as a pin, the bed was comfortable, and we had a ball. This was a First Class visit we would love to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Find a better hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: eurotouristatlarge
Reviews.Content: The gushing but artificial welcome turned out to be the highlight- the same member of staff seemed to fail to recall we were guests shortly after. Don't dare ask for a few minutes extension to checkout at 12 noon for whatever reason and don't expect to be asked if you've enjoyed your stay in Venice. Very poor breakfast even by Italian standards. For the significant amount of money this hotel charges, everything is superficial. There are far better hotels in Venice offering a much better standard of service and welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: EduardPlanting
Reviews.Content: I've been to Venice many times and have stayed in quite some (different) hotels, but I must admid I really liked the Bauer Palladio. This time I stayed 5 nights because for a visit to the Biennale. August usually isn't really the best of time for a visit (crowded and hot), but the tranquility of Guidecca Island makes you feel better after a busy day. We arrived late at night, were picked up at the airport by car, then a watertaxi to the hotel. 45 Minutes after arrival at the aiport we were enjoying the complimentary bottle of prosecco in the garden. That was a good start indeed! All through out our stay the staff was very friendly, the room was spacious and the shuttle boat to the main Island comfortable. Breakfast in buffet style was okay, but not the best in the world, although the great cappuccino and the sunny garden made it a pleasant start of the day. There's not much to do on Giudecca, but on the other hand, that's one of the advantages, because most tourists stay elsewhere. And .. there's enough to do on the other side of the water!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful oasis convenient to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: JWalkerAug2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Bauer Palladio after a cruise that ended in Venice. I was initially concerned that it wouldn't be close enough to "the action", but I was wrong. The hotel is a short (less than 5 minute) ride in their complimentary water taxi to their sister hotel, right next to San Marco. Our room was fantastic: it overlooked the lagoon, with spectacular views of San Marco, and cruise ships leaving the lagoon. The staff were very friendly and helpful, booking our water taxi to the airport and helping us print boarding passes. The garden is large and beautiful, and a quiet place to sit or for a meal after a day of heat and crowds. We had dinner and breakfast at the hotel, and they were both high quality, relaxing, and servers were friendly. I could have stayed much longer, and would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, just a short boat-ride from the crowded San Marco square”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: This gorgeous little hotel lies right on the waterfront of the little island of Giudecca, with a beautiful view over the Doge Palace and the San Marco square. The old convent, carefully refurbished into a hotel has a wonderful garden and is a sharp contrast to the crowded alleys of Venice. I stayed for a weekend in August with my husband and baby and I'm already longing to go back. The friendly staff and the serenity of the garden made us feel at home right away and our daughter loved to play on the lawn after a long day in a stroller. This is certainly the best hotel in Venice if you're travelling with children!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sunsetdrinks
Reviews.Content: If you want to get away from the crowds of Venice the island of Giudecca is the place, and on Giudecca the Bauer Palladio is a must. The hotel is a converted convent, situated on the water directly opposite San Marco. A free shuttle every half hour or so takes guests for the (less than) 5 minute trip from Giudecca to Venice and return. Coming back after a long day walking the streets of Venice and negotiating the crowds was like coming to the peace and quiet of home. We could sit quietly with the locals at nearby waterside cafes and enjoy a campari as we watched the sunset and the large tourist liners and glamorous private yachts passing by. This hotel offers 5 star luxury for an affordable price. We spent 4 nights in a double room (without a lagoon view) which was large and beautiful, with a superb view over the garden. We did not feel any need to upgrade.Breakfast (included in the tariff) was served in the extensive garden. The delightful, impeccably trained staff could always be relied upon to give advice and recommendations, whether we asked about vaporetta schedules, or Biennale venues or restaurants, and it was always suited to our particular needs. Visit Venice, but stay on Giudecca at the Bauer Palladio if you enjoy comfort and peace.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, and pigeons too”
Reviews.Author: MightyHamster
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in Bauer Palladio in Venice as part of our honeymoon tour of Italy. As we were in the hire car, hotels in Venice are notoriously hard to get to - parked at Piazza Roma San Marco car park, then got on number 2 water taxi - pretty efficient and away from the billions of people pouring through the main streets on the main Venice bit. The hotel is quiet, not sure if anyone else was staying there, but the staff were awesome - bottle of prosecco on ice in the room waiting for us, always friendly and the shuttle boat to and from San Marco square was ideal. I'm still yet to find a breakfast in a hotel in Italy that offers anything different from croissants, luke warm coffee, cheese and scrambled eggs.But they did the standard with aplomb - and it's cool that you can sit outside for breakfast although the pigeons eating my crumbs on my plate were a tad scary. Overall a good place to stay away from the masses in Venice, and the free boat every 30 mins makes all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, beautiful building with great garden and views.”
Reviews.Author: OVVZgz Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Comfotable rooms, good transfer by boat to S. Marco. Good views in a nice building. Staff not friendly

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but please fix the internet access”
Reviews.Author: WM573
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredibly beautiful-- historic building facing the lagoon and St Mark's square, gorgeously decorated rooms.Lovely common areas. Beautiful gardens. Very quiet location on Giudecca, yet a couple of minutes from the hustle and bustle of St Mark's Square. The staff are extremely friendly. The hotel is right near the ferry stop and the hotel provides a shuttle ferry to the Bauer hotel near St Mark's. I needed a reliable internet connection to connect to my office. The wireless internet in the room was hopelessly unreliable, with continuous breaks that destroyed my connection. The staff told me it worked better in the main lobby area. But guests in hotels of this calibre should not have to huddle over laptops in the lobby. It was quite impossible to work using the internet. Please fix this-- just about everyone needs good internet access now. There was no equivalent of a concierge. The staff didn't even have proper maps and, while very charming, were quite unable to provide advice on things to see. Please train the staff and give them basic maps and information. Breakfast was nice but clear plastic chairs in the lovely breakfast room look quite out of place.

Reviews.Title: “An island of calm in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kwokc
Reviews.Content: When friends heard that we were to spend a week in Venice in July, they predicted that the canals would stink, the heat would be unbearable and the crowds would be a curse. Well, the canals had no smell, we got lucky with the heat, and with our choice of hotel we trumped the crowd problem. We stayed six nights at the Bauer Palladio, housed in a former 16th century convent designed by the great architect Andrea Palladio. The waterfront hotel is on the Guidecca, the long, narrow island separated from St. Mark's Square and Venice's central islands by its widest canal. Relatively few visitors make it to this island, since there's only one attraction in the guide books, the Redentore church. So the crowds are across the water and most of the foot traffic along the quay is in the early morning or evening hours when the island's residents go to and return from work. But the Bauer has its own launch to take guests to the Grand Canal jetty of its sister hotel, the Bauer Hotel and Palazzo, itself a 3-minute walk from St. Mark's Square. The boat runs every 30 minutes from 10 a.m., the last return trip at 11:50 p.m. A ferry landing, served by four different lines, is less than 100 yards from the hotel's front door. So Venice's delights--and crowds--are just a 5-minute boat-ride away. Indoors, the hotel has a spacious and elegant lounge; a sunny breakfast room with shaded outdoor tables to which guests can bring food from the decent buffet; a restaurant, with a small bar, that we did not try; and a well-appointed spa where my wife got an "excellent" massage. Our peaceful room was a good size for Venice, with efficient AC and simple yet classy furnishings, a very comfortable bed and a pleasant bathroom with locally made herbal bath amenities. (One nuisance: A too-short shower screen made it impossible to keep water off the floor.) WiFi was included and worked well. Service was excellent and polite, though sometimes a bit hectic at breakfast. (One morning--an exception--it took 45 minutes to get a capuccino. Imagine--in Italy!) Requests for ice or extra towels always arrived in under 10 minutes. The smiling ladies at the front desk, mostly from eastern Europe, greeted us every time we passed, were efficient on every booking or restaurant confirmation we asked of them and were amazing in their command of languages--six in the case of Marina. Undoubtedly, a big part of the pleasure of this hotel is its location. The Guidecca is unassuming but full of charm and calm, narrow alleys running across the breath of the island among what look like blocks of low-cost residential apartments, offering a glimpse of everyday life; buildings rapidly be built or repurposed as luxury flats for foreigners away much of the time; boatyards and some spectacular views of the southern lagoon; a few convenience stores and one pocket supermarket; several pizza restaurants, a break-the-bank branch of the famous Harry's Bar and one hugh-end restaurant, I Figli Delle Stelle; a sprinkling of bars from whose quayside tables you can watch, a glass of cool wine or a "spritz" in hand, the passing varieties of ferries and other boats; gigantic cruise liners being tugged through the canal to their berths, dwarfing the entire city; and the sleek sea-going luxury yachts of the super-rich, so big that they barely move at anchor. Ahh, I wish I were there now. Note: The Bauer Palladio only operates from mid-March to mid-November.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jerimack
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic hotel - Italian inspired decorations, clean Beautiful view from my window of St. Marks across the Grand Canal Could see Cruise ships coming in from my window also. Beautiful bathroom - 1st class with bathroom, slippers, spa tub my kind of place!! Wonderful restaurant and hidden garden

Reviews.Title: “lovely garden and great staff”
Reviews.Author: mnt10014
Reviews.Content: The big attractions here are the peaceful garden and wonderful staff. Having breakfast in the garden makes you feel miles away from the crowds in Venice. The spa is lovely as well-great massage. The hotel itself has vast common rooms where complimentary prosecco and water is always available. The rooms are fairly stark-reminding you that this used to be a convent. Locations is a shuttle ride away from the san marco tourist madness-good or bad depending on what you are looking for. There are several good restaurants nearby-the hotel one is ok, not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “If it's Venice, it's Bauer Palladio”
Reviews.Author: aparnasomani
Reviews.Content: Extremely amazing service. They go out of the way, they go 4 miles long if they need to go only 1 to please u. Rooms. Service. Food. Ambience. Happy smiles. Recommendations. Arrangements. Everything is number UNO. Impressed

Reviews.Title: “Why the great ratings?????”
Reviews.Author: flashover5
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the great reviews but were severely disappointed by our experience here which started the second we got off the water taxi.Although the hotel says it's right at the taxi stop,there are also several other buildings at this location and the hotel forgot to bother to put a sign on its building.We did eventually spot a small 8" x 16" brass sign with wording about a small hotel association on it but no name-how bizarre ! Since we were a little early to check in we left our suitcases with the porter but were frustrated to find out that when we returned from sightseeing at 9 pm the suitcases had not yet been brought to our room.The area in the hallway outside our room was very dark since the light bulb that was meant to help you find the key card slot was burned out.The room itself was ok but the bed was not an actual double bed as promised but 2 twins pushed together with the prominent ridges of the mattress edges sticking up where they came together which prevented sleeping on that area.The door on the bathroom creaked louder than any horror scene movie and actually woke up my companion in the middle of the night.The cold water side of the bathroom sink provided only hot water even after letting it run for 5 minutes.They also never bothered to put handrails in the stairways.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but....”
Reviews.Author: dr_freud
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if the following are important to you - A good internet service In-room tea and coffee facilities English-language TV stations Movies on TV However, we were given a terrific room with a view of the lagoon and across to the main island. The hotel's own taxi service across to the San Marco area is frequent and enjoyable. The ambience of the hotel and the decor and gardens are beautiful and atmospheric and peaceful. In the late afternoon the views from our room of the sunset were spectacular. At breakfast choices were a little limited, e.g. my partner likes to have salmon or chicken or turkey at breakfast, but there was only ham and salami, even after we asked for different choices. This is not the standard to be expected from a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central but peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: gotiara
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my teenage daughter on a sightseeing weekend this hotel completely lived up to expectation. Located on the Giudecca waterfront it was easy to get around with a water bus stop almost outside the door.Travel to St Marco took about 10 minutes. Room was well appointed and the beds really comfortable. The service was of a good standard and was very welcoming. Certainly worth a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful refuge from the August crowds in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Francoitalian
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we arrived at their sister hotel to take their shuttle to the Palladio, we were in good hands. Everyone was pleasant and attentive; we felt truly welcome and at home in such pleasant surroundings. Between the buses and the occasional hotel shuttle, we were able to maneuver around the city with ease. We rarely relied on their shuttle given that there were many guests waiting when we set out but knew we could use it if needed. The manager seemed to make a point of greeting every guest and ensuring that everyone was enjoying the visit. Our daily breakfast in their magnificent garden was plentiful and the best way to start our eight days in Venice. Having a delicious Bellini from the bar was nice, too. We had heard that the food there was to be missed so we skipped this and went out every night. There are two complaints that I must voice. First, the housekeepers were the least pleasant of the MANY people we encountered. Sometimes we received a little sweet on a pillow or bedside table, most times we did not. My second frustration was that we were overwhelmed by mosquitoes during our stay. Given the locale, season and the apparent opening of windows while we were out to air the room, one must expect this type of thing. The magnificence of the hotel, however, more than makes up for these two complaints but it is good to know beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our two-week trip to Italy!”
Reviews.Author: bluedog723
Reviews.Content: Now this is a hotel! You can read all of the other comments about the structure and amenities. What struck me (and I'm very, very critical of service businesses) was their level of professionalism, class and above-and-beyond interest in knowing we were being well cared for. No other hotel of this type left us with a customer service comment card, to add one small comment here... Hotel Bauer left me with the highest impression that these folks know how to do hotels!! We would return there without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Not all its cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: GordonJones
Reviews.Content: I have to give this a mixed review. Lots of bargain stays at the Palladio available at the moment. And the entrance is lovely. The garden is great and the common rooms are grand and impressive. But something is wrong with this place. The bed was great and we were upgraded to a suite. But it was a suite with no natural light, the most horrible decoration and a certain in-built misery. Breakfast is disappointing and the bar is pricey. The communal areas aren't really used and they remain grand and - well a bit funereal. Some staff are lovely and some are really snotty. I think despite our "upgrade" the room we were given was reserved for people on bargain stays. And that's fine if you know it in advance, but if you don't its disappointing. The bathroom fixtures in our room didn't work and the air-con was weak. The position is good - if you don't want to be in the centre of things - but I can't help feeling there are nicer - if less grand places to stay in Venice. If you do stay here, the No 2 and 42/41 vaporettos stop at Zitelle just outside. And the restaurant just up the quayside is wonderful. The views are great too - but just don't expect one from your room!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and luxury: the perfect match!”
Reviews.Author: drzimmel
Reviews.Content: We staied at the Bauer Palladio at the beginning of August. As soon as we checked in, we were introduced to the young gm, Simone, which took us to our big room. If you're looking for a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons this is not the right place for you. Servce is much more personal, and intimate. and , if you have an issue, you can be sure it will fix it shortly by Simone and his friendly staff. It was very appreciated to see how the staff interacted with our young children. Gardens are beautiful...seems you lose the time over there....far from the Venice crowd... shuttle is very easy to use, and shcedules are explained very well at the check in. Breakfast was good enough as there are good dinner and light meals for lunch. overall a great experience and hopefully we will come back next year when the swimming pool will be completed.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, tranquil, just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: Finem50
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the best indicator of how our stay at the Bauer Palladio would be was the small sign above the entrance: no marquis, lights or any other indication that we were entering a hotel. Situated on the Isle of Giudecca, the Palladio was the perfect place to enjoy Venice at a distance when one wanted but only minutes away from Piazza San Marco. Our room, a suite, with a view of both the garden and the lagoon across to the Lido, was spacious, quiet, and restful. We enjoyed the beautiful garden and I guiltily admit to sitting in this lovely spot with my laptop and doing a bit of work. The service was impeccable, the food - we enjoyed both breakast and lunch, memorable. I would add that a short walk away from the hotel was the fine Figlie delle Stelle restaurant where we enjoyed three superb meals. Many visit the Palladio for the spa but we simply enjoyed being there and doing very little of anything.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel on a 2 Star level”
Reviews.Author: hhhtheone
Reviews.Content: The Breakfast Buffet is absolutely overprived and the food has been presented absolutely loveless. The flush knob in the bathroom has shown the fingerprints of the previous guest(s) and the turndown service was made with the absolutely minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Creating the Perfect Venice Escape”
Reviews.Author: sailgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed 4 days/3 nights at the beautiful and tranquil Bauer Palladio on Giudecca Island, literally 5 minutes across the lagoon from Piazza San Marco (St Mark's Square). I am already planning our return. We loved the location: on the island of Giudecca (next to the fabled Cipriani Hotel but at a fraction of the price), the Bauer Palladio is an oasis of stylish calm and tranquility that was especially welcome after a day of sight-seeing among the mobs of people across the lagoon. Giudecca is unhurried, uncrowded, with open spaces and breezes from the wide lagoon. I am puzzled by some other reviewers' complaints about their problems with the travel between the hotel and Venice "proper". A vaporetto (public transport water bus) runs about every 10 minutes, from early in the morning until the wee hours and the transfer time is 5 minutes. True, it's a bit pricey (Venice charges tourists an outrageous 6.50 per ride fee, quite a bit higher than what locals pay), but you can buy passes for unlimited rides for 12-, 24-, 48- or 72-hours, or by the week. With a little planning, you really don't need to pay for any transfers, just use the hotel shuttle eco boat (which DOES indeed exist, but on the one day it rained the hotel had hired a taxi boat for the transfers, I suppose the weather affects its operation). The hotel launch left at 10, 11 and noon each morning for the 5-minute ride, with service resuming 4 pm every hour until midnight (with 2 trips per hour from 5 until 8pm), so quite easy to have a night out in the main part of the city if one wished. We found it worked well to enjoy a leisurely breakfast in the beautiful gardens and then head into the touristic center for 5 or 6 hours of sight-seeing, after which we were relieved to return to the serenity of Giudecca. Finding our way back to the shuttle dock was no problem, we just made a note of the location when we first arrived. But even had we not, it's at the rather well-known Hotel Bauer and Bauer Palazzo, which are easily found on maps or by asking shop keepers in the area. Certainly no more challenging than finding your way back to ANY hotel among the narrow labyrinth of streets in Venice! We really viewed being removed from the heat, the crowds and the noise of central Venice as a massive "plus". The hotel would be easy to miss if you didn't know it was there, as the facade is the marble front of a 500-year-old church and convent. The hotel was indeed at one time a convent, lovingly and beautifully restored after a century of neglect. The only exterior indication that it's a hotel is a discreet brass plaque beside the door - a very classy touch in this age of blatant commercialism. Understated is a good word to describe the hotel. The restoration and conversion to hotel space was respectful of the building's past, with many original features intact, yet with all the modern conveniences. We booked a junior suite and were upgraded upon check-in to a full suite: two large rooms on the top floor with views over the property's expansive and lovely gardens, and to the blue waters of the lagoon and the Lido beyond. Ceilings were 16 feet high with original heavy wood beams. Windows were tall and opened fully to flood the room with sea breezes, birdsong and light. Furnishings were classic and understated. The bed was large and comfortable, we slept better than at home. We had a plasma satellite TV that we never felt the urge to turn on. Excellent high speed wifi access, with a lower charge for our entire stay (not by the day, but the stay!) than we're accustomed to paying for a single night at hotels elsewhere. (The wifi signal also extended to the hotel's gardens, so my husband was able to carry on business in the mornings while we relaxed on lawn chairs in the shade of a flower-laden pergola.) Our suite also offered what was called a "walk-in closet" but what I would call a full dressing room, and a beautiful, huge marble bathroom with jacuzzi tub and separate good-sized shower with acceptable water pressure, double sinks with miles of marble counter. Soft, thick towels and bathrobes. Good hairdryer. My only (small) criticism is the make-up/shaving mirror should have been lit, as the bathroom lighting - small pinpoint spotlights in the ceiling high above - wasn't quite sufficient for 54-year-old eyes to confidently apply eye-liner and mascara. But moving to a dressing table near the window solved the problem. The staff at this hotel have been impeccably trained. To a person, they found and maintained that delicate, precarious balance of being genuine and friendly without becoming overly familiar, warm and yet still professional. Personal service that was always efficient, and completely unobtrusive. Never fawning. No snooty attitude, and no sense of pandering for tips. Absolutely seamless and wonderful. My congratulations to whomever trains them! We were greeted by name upon arrival ("welcome, Mr. & Mrs. x", thank god they didn't presume to use our first names), the early check-in we had requested was ready when we arrived a bit before noon, and we were given a brief tour of the property including elements of its history as we were led to our room. We requested a late check-out the evening before our departure, and were graciously permitted to keep our room until our transfer to the airport - at 3:15 pm. The breakfast was the typical European buffet of breads and pastries, jams, yogurts, fresh fruit and fruit juices, cold meats and cheeses, but also with scrambled eggs and Italian ham if you wanted something hot. Everthing was of a high quality. You could choose to eat in the pretty breakfast room with its lovely mural - but who would, when the terrace beckoned with views over the lush gardens, the scent of lavender and jasmine in the air? The breakfast staff were cheerful and quick to bring the excellent coffee with (or without) hot milk, or tea or hot chocolate if one preferred. We loved the extensive gardens, and in fact one day just stayed on Giudecca, tearing ourselves away from the beautiful grounds only for an hour or two's exploration of our unhurried, quiet island. We had one meal in the hotel restaurant, an excellent lunch on the gorgeous terrace. (if you like sashimi, be sure to try the tuna carpaccio salad) But we couldn't resist dinners at a small restaurant about 100 meters' walk from the hotel, where the tables were peopled mainly by locals. We went there on our first night, lured by the tables set at water's edge for the views of the setting sun and changing light on San Marco across the lagoon. We went back for the great food at reasonable prices (and more of those glorious views). Our 4 days/3 nights at the Bauer Palladio were all we'd hoped for and more. We've enjoyed years of extensive international travel (a dozen trips or more per year), both on business and for pleasure, so we have a solid basis for comparison. We rate the Bauer Palladio as a wonderful "find" and our first choice for visiting Venice. We're already planning our return in 3 months.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: ItalyMid30s
Reviews.Content: I will never forget the nice touch of the personnel of this hotel: my wife and I were there with my parents, close to their 80s and celebrating their 50th wedding anniversary. We didn't tell the hotel porter, but he was kind enough (without being asked...) to upgrade my parents to a nice suite. Besides, this hotel is a peaceful oasis in Venice. Service is excellent, the building charming and different, and the fact that you have to use either a water taxi or a "vaporetto" to get to San Marco actually adds to the appeal of the place. We were there on a special fare we found on their website, and this obviously helps in having a good memory of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary from the madding crowd (but with easy access)”
Reviews.Author: Silver_Fox987
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights in the hotel before returning to London on the Venice Simplon Orient Express train. We were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary. We found the hotel comfortable, and the hotel staff friendly and welcoming. We did take advantage of the eco shuttle boat (that really does exist) but as we knew that we wanted to travel further than just accross the water to St Marks Square, we bought three day tourist tickets for the public transport water buses. The hotel breakfast was taken in the peaceful garden at the rear of the hotel. We had one evening meal in the hotel which was the best meal that we had in Venice. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Venice, Far from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: jbleenyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double with lagoon views. The first room not what I expected, with one high, narrow window that afforded little view or light. But upon request was given a larger room with two windows giving onto magnificent views of the lagoon as well as views of this quiet, intimate neighborhood of mostly "real" Venetians. From this point on, everything about this hotel was low-key professionalism, effciency and courtesy (the staff was friendly and helpful in that unobtrusive way I prefer rather than the false, forced cheer that is imposed on guests in many American hotels, just to take an example). We stayed during the week, so that may have accounted for the unusual quiet and calm in the hotel and the surroundings, but I loved this serenity and leisure, especially when we had the beautiful, spacious garden all to ourselves in the afternoon. This is a beautiful property, possibly unique among hotels in Venice, and the rooms are nicely appointed, though I would've preferred a slightly more "American" touch (especially in terms of bedding and sheets) in certain areas (also chairs) that have a huge bearing on actual comfort while in the room. A couple of caveats. There is a solar-powered shuttle boat that ferries guests between the hotel and the main island, but it does not run from noon to about 5. But Giudecca is by no means isolated. We took the hotel shuttle only twice during our three nights/four days. Most of the time we got around much more efficiently on the vaporetto (the transit cards are sold in the little cafe/store right next to the hotel). Also, the hotel bar/restaurant doesn't serve full meals, but what they call "snacks," light salad, sandwiches, etc. But there are a few restaurants right on the island of Giudecca if you want a decent meal, and of course you can always take the shuttle across the lagoon to dine in any one of Venice's many restaurants on the main island. But most of the time, after spending a day doing the tourist things on the main island, we were relieved and happy to be returning to Giudecca, a charming island of real Venetians living their daily lives (but it also seems increasingly destined soon to be a more tourist-oriented island as there are many signs of development). It already has the Bauer Palladio, the Cipriani and some Hilton behemoth on the far end of the island. I would prefer it stay the way it is. A little out of the way but worth it for those who want to be alone with a Venice of their own far from the madding crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Don't confuse this hotel with the real Hotel Bauer”
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: The Bauer Palladio Hotel and Spa is a great old monastery that has been converted to a stark hotel and spa. It's a draw for a difference, but the rooms are sparsely furnished and after awhile, it does become a hassle to go across the canal to be in the heart of Venice for dinner or doing some sightseeing. If you want solitude and quiet time and don't care much about decor, the Palladio is the place to stay in Venice. Otherwise, i prefer staying at the primary Hotel Bauer Palazzzo property.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: MrsPEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing hotel we have ever stayed in. We were in Venice for our honeymoon and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff upgraded our room which was lovely surprise and we got the honeymoon suite. The room was truly out of this worldâ€¦â€¦â€¦. The staff were incredibly friendly and polite and catered to our needs. They regularly helped us plan our day and recommend places to eat. The lounge area was great, which throughout our stay, was constantly referred to as â€˜our living roomâ€™. It was a lovely old Victorian style setting, with comfortable couches where you can sit and have a glass of wine or a cup of tea by the fire. Breakfast was amazing so much choice and so fresh â€“ we were constantly over eating â€“but it was worth it. Didnâ€™t have dinner there but the food did look nice. They also had live music in the bar are which was quite relaxing. Location wise the hotel is on the quieter side of the city but there is a regular shuttle bus between the hotel and its sister hotel on the other side of the water (only takes a couple of minutes) so its not a problem at all and is actually quite nice to get away from the hustle and bustle. The shuttle bus is regular and reliable and we encountered no problems. The side of the water the hotel is on was quite handy if you wanted to get the water bus to Murano. Definitely recommend this hotel especially for a special occasion- we plan to go back on our 10 year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Fussy traveller highly recommends here”
Reviews.Author: catecate
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Venice, and an excuse to escape my ex husband's marriage to the mistress he left me for. Ha ha I milked this excuse for all it was worth and had an fantastic time. This hotel is an absolute haven from the hustle and bustle of Venice. Located on the island of Guidecca there is a shuttle boat to take you from the hotel to the main Venice island and back again. I love everything Venice has to offer but it does get crowded and busy so knowing you can escape back to this lovely hotel with a walled garden is wonderful. The room was quite small but once I swung open the shutters I spent ages reading with the courtyard garden in the background. The spa was ok, the best bit was the relaxation room overlooking the canal. With smokey windows no one can look back at you. Apparently the hotel is next door to Elton John's apartment. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the relaxed breakfast in the courtyard garden a wonderful way to start the day before exploring every nook and cranny of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelSeattle67
Reviews.Content: The history of this hotel was amazing. It was a gorgeous retreat. It is removed from the Venice craziness, yet only takes a few minutes to get to. The gardens were beautiful - very unexpected. We were only wishing we could stay longer...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: THFC1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with my Wife, our first visit to Venice together. The hotel is on the quayside on La Giudecca, literally opposite the mouth of the Grand Canal and San Marco. The airport is on the other side of Venice to the hotel, so our tip would be arrange for a water-taxi from Marco Polo Airport as it brings you through the middle of Venice along some of the canals, rather than the water bus which skirts around the city. This is admittedly an expensive option, but really worth it, especially if this is your first trip to Venice, as in our case. The hotel is in an ancient, monastery type building with fantastic period arches, passage ways and tiled floors. The view from our small but beautiful 2nr floor room we believe must be one of the best in Venice: looking out directly across the lagoon to the Grand Canal & San Marco. Unfortunately, it would seem that only a small number of rooms have this view and I think weâ€™d have been a little disappointed had our room faced another direction. I guess you could request this whilst booking. Donâ€™t be put off by the fact the hotel is not on the main Venice island â€“ the hotel has a little boat which runs all day from outside the hotel to the sister hotel across the water (solar powered!) â€“ the trip takes 5 minutes and we never had to wait more than 10 minutes for the boat. The hotel it connects with is in a very convenient location on the bank of the Grand Canal just 5 minutes walk to San Marco Square. This runs right the way through till late. There is also a Water-Bus stop 25m from the Palladio which takes you to lots of other locations around the city â€“ the boats stop here every 5 minutes. We used the Spa at the hotel for a massage which was wonderful, however came with the usual hefty price tag - but nevertheless, a great way to spend a lazy Saturday morning. The only improvement I would make to the hotel is to address the lack of a decent bar. There is a bar / restaurant but this closes at 11pm and then it seemed to be at the discretion of the staff whether they would serve you after this in the lounge area. I would have thought that the hotel could justify putting something in place, especially as there isn't a great deal of bars within walking distance. Generally, we loved this place and we'll be recommending it to everyone! The staff were friendly and we more than happy to give us advice on places to visit and how get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ShereKhan30
Reviews.Content: Amazing place. You feel as if you are walking into a remnant of the past. The desk staff are the most courteous, caring and helpful people I have come across in my world travels. NOTHING was too much. Arriving late of an evening we were upgraded to a suite, which was amazing. Dressing area, small lounge and marble bathroom. The building is supposedly a converted convent, but they have done some amazing updates! The grounds are beautiful (unfortunately it rained the whole time we were there!) and the rooms were warm, inviting and the high ceilings were delightful. The hotel has a courtesy shuttle to main Venice / St Marks square, but (be warned) it does not cross under bad weather conditions (it is a solar boat!) Food and drink is extortionate here for Aussie standards so we mainly ate in main Venice. However, we were caught in a storm that kept us in the hotel one night and we had to eat in the main restaurant (as we couldnt get to the mainland) but I have to say both the food, and the service was superb (albeit VERY expensive - $350.00 AUS for two). But, yes, I would definately go again to the same place. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Simondrake001
Reviews.Content: I simply can not put into words how divine this little sanctuary of peace and relaxation is ! The decor is perfect and the staff unobtrusive but attentive in every way. Food was great and water shuttle a lovely little perk. Will look forward to returning to my new found little oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, high quality & peaceful hotel, with helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ruthie2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this superb hotel for a week. The rooms were luxurious and the hotel very quiet and peaceful. The gardens were beautiful, the staff welcoming, helpful and attentive. The shuttle boat was always available within minutes and we had a wonderful, relaxing time. Some of the reviews we read before we went said to avoid the hotels restaurant for evening meals, as it was very expensive. However, we found that all restaurants were very expensive in Venice, and at least at the hotel, you would be sure that the standard of service, ambience and food would be excellent. Breakfast was plentiful - our advice would be to book a junior suite with breakfast included. All food is expensive in Venice, so best to start the day with a good meal that will see you through to the evening. As with all restaurants in Venice, drink bottles of wine rather than shorts to keep the price of an evening meal bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it.”
Reviews.Author: tpg3933
Reviews.Content: We paid for a double and got stuck in a pokey back-room with little space and a view of an internal shaft to delight us. The hotel staff were polite and mannerly, but the prices for room-service were the most outrageous rip-offs I have ever experienced. We moved to another hotel after two days, our experience ruined for those. Perhaps other visitors got better rooms, but ours was dark and cramped. Location is very good though, handy for St. Mark's Square, though the one we moved to was much closer and much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Britelines
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adored the Bauer Palladio! Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 3 nights celebrating our anniversary and our whole experience was faultless! Although we did not eat at the hotel restaurant, the breakfast was lovely and it was literally eat as much as you want! One thing I would advise anyone staying here is not to bother with booking any tickets for the water-bus service up front. We was tempted to but on arrival found that there was enough to see within walking distance and so didn't need to use it. The hotel has a private boat that runs across the water from Giudecca to another Bauer hotel literally 5/10 minutes away from St Marks Square. All other popular tourist attractions (Rialto Bridge/Market, Ca' d'Oro, Jewish Ghetto, the Casino) can be reached on foot so all I would suggest is investing in a good pair of shoes and take a good map! In fact even on Giudecca itself there are some lovely churches and other buildings and if you fancy a quiet private walk then it's definietely hidden away from all the hustle & bustle in St Marks Square. I definitely would stay here again! Just for longer next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Situated”
Reviews.Author: Afajob
Reviews.Content: If you have booked to stay in the hotel during your visit to Venice you will not be disappointed. This hotel is in a perfect position overlooking the Grand Canal. It is away from the hustle and bustle of the main land reached by a short trip via water bus or free hotel shuttle boat. I notice several comments about the star rating of the hotel, I do not know if this hotel is really worthy of its five stars or not. It was a very nice, clean hotel with complementary slippers, dressing gown and you return at the end of the day to find your curtains closed, slippers at the side of your bed and your bed sheets turned down. Only disappointment no tea making facilities in room, how did we cope! To avoid the prices of the mini bar in the room buy drinks from the many little shops just a long from the hotel. I personally found the staff friendly and courteous but what the hotel offered in terms of facilities was not explained. I think the key is to ask for information at reception where to eat, where to go etc. The staff have all the information including maps of Venice. In retrospect I would have asked where to eat outside of the hotel as eating can be expensive in Venice. Although the hotel was beautifully renovated it did still hold that sense of its historical past. The thing that really worried me when booking this trip was transportation as we were making our own way to and from the airport. However this was really straight forward and we bought a water bus ticket which gets you easily around Venice and the Island of Giudecca (on which the hotel is situation). Have a great trip and hopefully you will have the experience of sitting on one of the benches outside the hotel viewing Venice in the distance as one of the enormous cruise liners passes on its way down The Grand Canal, an amazing site.

Reviews.Title: “Rude service, beutiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathyre
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fabulous room, great location, but the concierge, bell captain, and front desk help were terrible. The concierge's primary concern seemed to be doing as little as possible for the hotel guests. The front desk gave us 3 different bills before getting to the "correct amount". On the day that we were leaving, I gave our bags to the bell captain and told the him that we were expecting a water taxi at 10:00. As we stood checking out, about 15 feet from him, he let our taxi go, and then told us that it was our fault for being at the front desk. He was unspeakably rude and unhelpful. We have stayed at many fine hotels and the service at the Bauer is simply not first class. We left no tip for either the concierge or the bell captain. They may think that it was because we were just "stupid Americans", but it was because they were "rude Italians".

Reviews.Title: “Consider the Bauer Palladio for your trip to Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Ronp123
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel for staying in Venice. Located on the island of Guidecca which is a short (5 minute) boat ride directly to St. Marks. The boat is free service provided by the hotel - runs all day and into the night. Hotel is luxury costing about 30% less than its peers located on San Marcos island. Big rooms, great views, peaceful garden, truly helpful staff all conspired to make this a great stay. Only downside was a less than stellar restaurant. no problem since there are plenty of places to eat. highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place but !!”
Reviews.Author: ThePrinceFamily
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Venice (4 nights) recently and we choose to stay on the Giudecca island. This is the place to be, the most wonderful view on St Marco square, the traffic on the canal,.... The Palladio is close to the Cipriani, that's a reference. We stayed in one the suite (2 most expensive) and I must tell it's worth the price. All you expect from a great hotel is there, you name it. Just one thing we regret: the deco of the restaurant and break-fast room. The hotel is an ex convant and the deco respect it but the choice of color (green) gives you headache first thing in the morning. We did'nt test the spa (who comes to Venice to spa?) We love the solar shuttle boat, it's a trip in itself. Crew perfect, helpful and all.. Strongly recommanded. ;-) will come again if we win the loto

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: milmol_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the bauer palladio for a family holiday to venice in April. We had 4 rooms, and the hotel gave us four rooms next to one another which was fantastic. We booked standard rooms, but they were huge, lovely spacious bathrooms too, and lots of little touches which gave it the true '5-star' feel... slippers, bathrobes etc. Everything about the hotel had a touch of luxury about it, the front desk staff were really helpful at all times, and the courtesy boat across to Venice was great, but even if you didnt want to wait for the boat, the water bus across was every 10 minutes and only a 5 minute ride. The breakfasts were excellent, plenty of choice and quality every morning with good service. The bar prices were also 5 star (10Euros for a beer?) but we found a fantastic little wine shop a few minutes along the road (next courtyard opposite the waterbus stop) where the lady offered tastings of the wine and some really good wine which she sold for around 2 Euros a litre!! Fantastic stay at the Bauer Palladio, if we go to venice again I would definitely check out the Bauer Palladio first.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem !”
Reviews.Author: ElisabetNetherlands
Reviews.Content: What an experience ! ! The Bauer Palladio is an absolute Gem!! The location is perfect, just five minutes by the complementary solar driven boat to mainland Venice. The hotel an old convent beautifully restaured in keeping with old details, very quite and peacefull. Rooms are perfect, Breakfast excellent and everyone, from doorman to waitress kind and helpfull. This is topclass Hotellerie !!

Reviews.Title: “Away From The Crowds”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller1944
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We had a 4 day break to celebrate our 25th - our first visit to Venice. The hotel organised our transport from the airport (a shared taxi at 30 euros each well worth it). The hotel is a 5 minute boat trip across the lagoon and takes you away from the maddening crowds around San Marco. Our room, overlooking the garden was large, clean and bright, bathroom was excellent. Staff were attentive and helpful but always discreet. We didn't eat in the hotel because the dining room was not open for 2 out of our 3 nights there but breakfast was excellent. The Spa was not easliy accessIble and we did not bother with it. The Shuttle bus was entirley reliable. We would rate the hotel at the top end of our ranking - and we have stayed at a number of 5 star hotels around Europe. Anyone downgrading this hotel must have very high standards indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Citydweller2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bauer Palladio about a year ago and absolutely loved it. We had a very rainy weekend in Venice and having such a lovely hotel to come back to made all the difference. The staff were charming, especially in the the bar/restaurant, and the hotel itself was beautifully renovated, We were upgraded to a suite with an enormous terrace which was really special - even in the rain! The quiet location on Giudecca (pretty much next door to the Cipriani) really suited us and it was really easy to get around: not just using the hotel shuttle, but also using the water buses. We're very fussy about our hotels but this one is very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Refined Class”
Reviews.Author: FrankieBerkshire
Reviews.Content: This unpretentious hotel delivered on all levels for us. The price we paid was great for the refined grandeur of the Palladio. I'm a flight attendant and i stay in many 4* hotels and i can certainly see the difference between them and this 5*. Anything we asked for was provided without fuss and the hotel really had a feeling of exclusivity about it (2 doors down from Elton John). We didn't use the restuarant, spa or bar as we were only on a short break and wanted to get into VCE and the lagoon. The breakfast was european in style and the staff attentive. The reception manager and the housekeeping staff were exceptional. The room we had was spotless and spacious. Must less stuffy than the sister hotels over the water in which we felt somewhat uncomfortable. We had a great stay and the private boat shuttle was a bonus. We used public transport as taxis were pricey and we bought a 'Rolling Venice Card' available to under 29's. This saved us packets on entrance fees and on the 72hr public transport ticket. Just present your passport at the tourist info desk in the airport. The best 4 euro i've ever spent.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: chloeadrian
Reviews.Content: My partner had taken it upon himself to take me on a suprise weekend away to Venice, and this hotel made it the best weekend away ever! The hotel isn't on main Venice itself, but a short water bus ride away on a small island called Giudecca. This meant the views were amazing, not stuck down a busy high street but across the river. On first approach as we arrived, I was a bit thrown back as it didnt look like any hotel I'd stayed in, almost like a run down church (I was to learn later that it infact had been renovated from a derelict church). And the door you went through looked like the servicemans entrance rather than thr big church doors. But once inside I could not havw imagined it. There is a man employed to open the door for guests all day everyday, and despite the mind numbingly boring job, he remained very cheerful and pleasant. The reception staff are very friendly and very helpful, speak excellent english. We were shown to our room with out bags carried for us. They had two lifts to our floor, very quick, and sturdy. The room was exqusite, marble floors, a very spacious marble bathroom, walk in closet area, and the bedroom was huge! The bed could have easily fitted 3 people, very comfortable. There was a new LCD television, the only english channels being eurosport, BBC Sport and another sport channel but wasn't really on much. The room had high ceilings with wooden beams, and just had a wonderful peacefulness about it. We had views of the river and Venice, and when all lit up at night was so lovely. We stayed B&B, breakfast was served (i think) between 7:30 and 10:30 (dont quote me, may be wrong) The restaurant was very clean, staff were the friendliest and i didn't see anyone having a problem being seated. It had wonderful views of the garden. The staff were ever so friendly and also spoke very good english. They had a lounge area, which was beautiful, they had a massive fireplace which they would put on for you if you were sat there, even at midday. they would come and ask you if you would like any drinks, and brought them over to you. All the staff were wonderful, and would bend over backwards to make sure you had a good stay. We decided to dine in the restaurant one evening, in which we were seated at our usual breakfast table, with a guitarist playing easy listening music in the corner of the room. Our favourite waiter Tach served us, he was the friendliest man you could ever meet. Meal sizes were large and we were brought a lovely basket of homemade bread of all sorts, and home made parma, plus homemade pumpkin bread and parma ham. It was to die for! It was fairly expensive but not in comparison to the other places we had dined in Venice, we payed at least Â£100 euros for not a lot of dinner most places (except for McDonalds...oh yes we found one!!). My partner booked me in for a tone massage at the spa. I was to go to reception 15 mins prior to my booking, where i was greeted by the spa receptionist. She led me to the spa which was through a door, down an outside corridor into another building (this was not a public passageway, was exclusive to the hotel) I was shown around, there was a shower and sauna to use if i wanted, then I changed into a lovely warm dressing gown and slippers and was shown to the "relaxtion room" and it definitely was relaxing. Dim lights, candles, herbal teas, huge sofa over looking a two way mirror, so you could see the lit up Venice, moon shining on the river (I had the massage about half 7pm). My masseuse came in, she was ever so friendly and told me what she would be doing, how the stones work, etc. the whole massage took about 1 hour 45 mins, and well worth every penny. I'd never had a stone massage before, and it was an amazing experience. All in all the Bauer Palladio was a wonderful place to stay, we were there often as we had done most of the sights we wanted to see, and the staff made it a wonderul experience, as did the hotel itslef. I'd definitely recommend this place to stay if venturing to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: barleybuddy
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at this hotel due to previous reviews regarding quality and service. I have been to Venice on several occasions and find that a proper hotel is key to a fantastic stay. This was a surprise trip for my boyfriend's birthday. We had flight trouble, thus we arrived a day late. I informed the hotel about our troubles and they allowed us to stay an additional night and upgraded us to a suite free of charge (additionally not charging for the night we missed). The staff was wonderful and the room deluxe. The bath and spa are fantastic. The breakfast buffet is plentiful with excellent service. We will stay here on our return visit. Incredible. Quiet. Relaxing. -Amy Wood, Tennessee

Reviews.Title: “ADEQUATE BUT I WOULD NOT BOOK AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: veryhardtoplease
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a weekend at the Bauer Palladio (be aware this is NOT the same as the Bauer Palazzo which is across the Grand Canal) with my wife for a friend's wedding. We stayed at the Cipriani on our last trip but this was full, and they recommended the adjacent Palladio on the Giudecca island. Before arrival I called to book the spa and it took over a minute for the hotel to answer. When we got there, the hotel was not what we expected. It's a converted convent which until last year was a conference centre. The entrance is anonymous, a small door next to the church. If it's glitz you're after, this hotel is not for you. The decor is a little austere, unlike, say, other converted religious buildings like the Villa San Michele, and there are still touches of conference centre if you look closely: the modern fire doors and fabric covering the walls of the lifts to hide the stainless steel beneath. The service, however, was great from the moment we arrived. We had booked a suite with canal view at Eu.650 +10%. We were shown to a suite with a garden view, and then to a smaller one with a tiny window overlooking the canal, so accepted the first which was huge and comfortable. There were small issues which will probably be resolved with time: the shower head broke, the sink plug wouldn't open and the bath had no water pressure (quickly fixed). Half of the room lights stopped working and my wife thought the room smelt of furniture varnish. The spa was small but welcoming and not busy. We didn't use the restaurant but room service breakfast was indifferent and expensive- Eu.75 in 'extras' for a half melon, scrambled eggs and 2 bowls of porridge is a bit much. There's a free shuttle boat to get you to town but beware it takes 10 minutes to arrive and another 10 to get you there, so staying here is not ideal if you want to spend a lot of time between the sights and your hotel. On the other hand, it's peaceful and the rooms are larger than in town. Also, compared to some other five star hotels like the Cipriani, the rates are keener. Our friends were spending Eu.3k a night for a suite there which they didn't rate at all. To sum up, the Palladio is OK but it lacks the wow factor I want for a five star romantic weekend away. For our next trip we'll probably try the Baglioni. .

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Bauer Palladio”
Reviews.Author: Sneakerguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bauer Palladio in part because other hotels in Venice were sold out. I was soooo pleasantly surprised by the quality of the rooms and the wonderful service. My initial hesitation came from reading all of the reviews and the lack of overwhelming satisfaction with the hotel. I can safely say that the hotel is fabulous. The rooms are a good size and well appointed. The candid pictures on the Trip Advisor site do not do the room justice. The rooms are elegant and have lots of character. The cathedral ceiling adds beauty and ambiance. The bathrooms are very well appointed and luxurious. They have all of the amenities that you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The only small knock against the hotel is location. This turns out to be a positive and negative. The negative is that you are a boat ride away from all of the Venice action. Sometimes you want to just wake up and get going with the sight seeing. However, the positive is that they offer a free shuttle that takes you back and forth to the main part of Venice. The shuttle is frequent and quick. The other positive is that you are away from all of the tourist which is sometimes a nice change of pace. In many ways you feel like you are on your own little island with a limited number of guests. Lastly, the service has been incredible. Everyone has gone out of their way to assist and make our stay wonderful. The staff understands and can speak English which is never an expectation but a pleasant surprise. I am confident that if you are seeking a romantic getaway with great staff and a little off of the normal beaten path, you will thoroughly enjoy the Bauer Palladio.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful hotel but dreadful service”
Reviews.Author: Alain42
Reviews.Content: Palladio Bauer really is a beautiful hotel and it would be quite unfair to complain about the amenities. It is also marvelously quiet and conveniently located on Guidecca island just opposite San Marco. But is really a 5 star luxury hotel ? The question makes sense as the service is just unacceptable. We had to wait 25 minutes on the day of our arrival to check in as the front desk is too small to take two guests at the same time and some clients made difficulties when checking out, so all we could do was wait during all that time. Don't expect a proper doorman as in any normal luxury hotel. There is either no doorman at the front door, or, if there is one, he may be busy doing something else than opening the door for you or... he may just stand behind the door but not mind open the door for you and just watch you push the door ! We often had to wait half an hour and even once, one full hour to have a shuttle boat between hotel Pallazo Bauer and hotel Palladio Bauer as there were many guests during the Mostra. However, when you are in Venice, there is so much to see that you do not intend to spend all your time on the quay of one of the two hotels... The concierge could have called a taxi boat, but did nothing, which really was very surprising. We were so disappointed by the poor quality of service that we had to write to the director of the hotel when we were back to France. All she could do was say that she wasn't there and that she was sorry !!! Is that luxury ??
